intro: Doritis pulcherrima f. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered torch ginger, is a hybrid form of the torch ginger plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking white bracts that surround small, delicate flowers, giving it a dramatic appearance. The plant is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and other ornamental plants. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil and partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for tropical gardens and indoor cultivation.
